member.name: T:Xceed.Compression.Decompressor
member.summary: An abstract class from which other classes can derive to implement custom decompression algorithms.
member.remarks:
This class (and its subclasses) will primarily be used by the class.
A subclass must at least implement the abstract method.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.Decompressor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.Decompressor.Decompress(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Decompresses an array of bytes.
member.param: An array of bytes to decompress. A maximum of bytes are taken from this array and decompressed.
The byte offset in at which to begin taking the data to decompress.
The maximum number of bytes to be taken from .
if the end of the compressed data has been reached; otherwise.
An array of bytes containing the decompressed data. Can be empty if no bytes were decompressed.
The number of unused bytes read from buffer the for decompression.
member.returns: The number of bytes written to the parameter.
member.remarks:
When the first call to Decompress is made, a decompression "session" is created. This session remains opened as long as Decompress is called with the parameter set to False.
During a decompression session, the decompression engine can choose to keep the data to decompress in an internal buffer and return an empty array after a call to Decompress. This could happen if not enough compressed data has yet been provided to determine the decompressed result.
When Decompress is called with the parameter set to True, the decompression session is closed and all of the remaining decompressed data is returned. The next call to Decompress will create a new decompression session.
The array may have a Length greater than the number of bytes returned by the call to Decompress.

member.name: T:Xceed.Compression.Compressor
member.summary: Abstract class from which other classes can derive to implement custom compression algorithms.

remarks.para: This class (and its subclasses) will primarily be used by the class.
A subclass must at least implement the abstract method.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.Compressor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.Compressor.Compress(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Compresses an array of bytes.
member.param: An array of bytes to compress. A maximum of bytes are taken from this array and compressed.
The byte offset in at which to begin taking the data to compress.
The maximum number of bytes to be taken from .
Indicates if this call ends the stream of data to compress.
An array of bytes containing the compressed data. Can be empty.
member.returns: The number of bytes written to the parameter.
member.remarks:
When the first call to Compress is made, a compression "session" is created. This session remains opened as long as Compress is called with the parameter set to False.
During a compression session, the compression engine can choose to keep the data to compress in an internal buffer and return an empty array after a call to Compress. Many compression algorithms do this to get optimum compression by examining a certain number of bytes before compressing anything.
A call to Compress with an empty or a of zero tells the compression engine to flush its internal buffer and return the compressed data. This may degrade the compression ratio.
When Compress is called with the parameter set to True, the compression session is closed and all of the remaining compressed data is returned. The next call to Compress will create a new compression session.
The array may have a Length greater than the number of bytes returned by the call to Compress.

member.name: T:Xceed.Compression.CompressionInternalException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown when something unexpected occurs while compressing or decompressing data.

remarks.para: This exception means that there was an internal failure in the library, and that nothing could be done to prevent it. Such failures should never occur.
To get more details about what went wrong, you can inspect the property. It is a reference to the exception that caused the internal failure.
If you ever catch this exception in your code, please contact Xceed Software Technical Support immediately.

member.name: T:Xceed.Compression.CompressionException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown when there is a problem compressing or decompressing data.

remarks.para: This exception serves as the base class for all custom exceptions defined in the Xceed.Compression namespace.
Since this exception is thrown by the object, it derives from . This is because any code that use streams will expect an IOException to be thrown in case of errors while working with the stream.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception with the specified message text.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception with the specified message text and inner exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that initially caused the current exception to be thrown.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressionInternalException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressionInternalException.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception with the specified inner exception.
member.param: The exception that initially caused the current exception to be thrown.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressionInternalException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception with the specified message test.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: F:Xceed.Http.DataEncodingMode.Base64
member.summary: The Base64 encoding format as defined by RFC-2045 and the XML specification. Used by the MIME format to encode email attachments. This encoding mode is provided to support browsers that do not allow non-ASCII data to be uploaded.

member.name: T:Xceed.Http.Licenser
member.summary: Class which is used to register the classes located in the Xceed.FileSystem namespace.

remarks.para: We recommend you set the LicenseKey property in the main entry point of the application. For example, the LicenseKey property can be set, for C# users, in the static main function. For VB.NET users, it can be set in the constructor of the main form or in the "Sub Main" procedure. If no entry point is available, it is recommended that the LicenseKey property be set in a static constructor of a class that will be accessed systematically before any of the library's classes are instantiated or, you can simply set the LicenseKey property immediately BEFORE you instantiate a class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the license key used to license this product.
member.value: A string value representing the license key used to license this product.

member.name: T:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream
member.summary: Pass-through stream that applies compression and decompression to an inner stream.

remarks.para: Compression is applied to data being written to the stream, and decompression is performed when data is read from the stream.
The compression engine itself is not built into the class. Instead, user-supplied and classes are used.
It is possible to implement your own compression algorithm by implementing classes derived from and .
By default, closing the will also close the inner stream. This behavior can be modified by setting the property to .

member.name: F:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.m_readSize
member.summary: Represents the number of bytes to read from the inner stream each time decompressed data is needed.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,Xceed.Compression.Compressor)
member.summary: Initializes a compress-only using the provided compressor class.
member.param: Inner stream.
Compressor class used to perform data compression.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,Xceed.Compression.Decompressor)
member.summary: Initializes a decompress-only using the provided decompressor class.
member.param: Inner stream.
Decompressor class used to perform data decompression.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,Xceed.Compression.Compressor,Xceed.Compression.Decompressor)
member.summary: Initializes a using the provided compressor and decompressor classes.
member.param: Inner stream.
Compressor class used to perform data compression.
Decompressor class used to perform data decompression.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.Flush
member.summary: Causes all pending compressed data to be written to the inner stream, and updates the underlying data source or repository of the inner stream with the current state of the buffer.

remarks.para: This may degrade compression for some compression algorithms, so it should be used only when necessary.
remarks.note: Even if all the inner buffers are flushed, the inner stream will not be complete unless the is called. This is because when the CompressedStream is closed it writes the final compressed information to the inner stream; Flush does not.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: A CompressedStream object is not seekable.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: A CompressedStream object is not seekable.

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads and decompresses a sequence of bytes from the inner stream.
member.param: An array of bytes. A maximum of bytes are stored in this array.
The byte offset in at which to begin storing the data decompressed from the inner stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be stored in .
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the . This may be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes aren't currently available, or zero if the end of the stream has been reached. Applications must check the return value to prevent data corruption.

remarks.para: The object reads and decompresses data from the inner stream into a private buffer, and uses this buffer to satisfy Read requests. If a such a request cannot be satisfied, more data is read and decompressed from the inner stream.
When Read returns a positive value, it means that there is more uncompressed data available in the buffer, but the end of the inner stream could have already been reached.
When this method returns 0, it really means that all of the inner stream's data has been read and decompressed.
If the reading process to decompress the byte array has already begun, will always return .

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compresses and writes a sequence of bytes to the inner stream.
member.param: An array of bytes. A maximum of bytes are taken from this array and compressed into the inner stream.
The byte offset in at which to begin taking the data.
The maximum number of bytes to be taken from .
member.returns: The total number of bytes written to the inner stream. This may be less than the parameter. It may even be 0.

remarks.para: In order to achieve optimum compression, some compression algorithms store data to compress into internal buffers before actually compressing it.
When Write returns, all the data provided in the parameter has been successfully given to the compressor, but has not necessarily been written to the inner stream.
The return value of this method represents the number of compressed bytes that have been actually written to the inner stream.
If you need to write all pending data to the inner stream, you can call the method on the .
If the writing process to compress the byte array has already begun, will always return .

member.name: M:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.GetRemainingStream
member.summary: Retrieves a stream which starts immediately after the last byte of compressed data.
member.returns: A containing the data located immediately after the last byte of compressed data allowing you to continue reading the data.

remarks.para: In order to access the remaining data, the CompressedStream's property must be set to .
In the case where more than one chunks of compressed data are appended to each other in the same stream, you can use the GetRemainingStream method to decompress the next chunk of compressed data.

Closing the stream returned by the GetRemainingStream method will not close the inner stream. You will need to call the inner stream's Close method yourself once you are finished with the returned stream.
GetRemainingStream must be called before the CompressedStream's method is called.

member.name: F:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.m_stream
member.summary: The inner stream.

member.name: F:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.m_compressor
member.summary: Compressor class to use for compression.

member.name: F:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.m_decompressor
member.summary: Decompressor class to use for decompression.

member.name: F:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.m_delayedInitialization
member.summary: The (De)Compressor will be created when needed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.m_endOfData
member.summary: Represents the endOfData parameter to pass to the compressor/decompressor classes.

remarks.para: It is false as long as data is being compressed/decompressed, and the finalizer sets it to true before calling Flush.

member.name: F:Xceed.Compression.CompressedStream.m_noCompression

member.name: T:Xceed.Utils.Exceptions.ExceptionFilter
member.summary: Exposes utility methods for filtering exceptions.

member.name: M:Xceed.Utils.Exceptions.ExceptionFilter.IsPublicException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Determines if an exception can be thrown by a public method.
member.param: The exception to evaluate.
member.returns: true if the exception can be thrown as-is; false if the exception should be converted.
member.remarks: Every public method should have a final exception handler for any un-caught exceptions that should call this method to determine if the exception can be thrown as-is to the caller (i.e. if the exception makes sense to the caller), or if it should be wrapped in a more meaningful exception for the caller.

member.name: F:Xceed.Http.EncryptionMethod.None
member.summary: No compression is applied.

member.name: T:Xceed.Http.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Represents the amount of compression to be applied when compressing data. The greater the amount of compression applied, the greater the time it takes to perform the compression.

member.name: F:Xceed.Http.CompressionLevel.None
member.summary: No compression is applied.

member.name: F:Xceed.Http.CompressionLevel.Lowest
member.summary: Minimum compression. Takes the least amount of time to compress data.

member.name: F:Xceed.Http.CompressionLevel.Normal
member.summary: Normal compression. Best balance between the time it takes to compress data and the compression ratio achieved.

member.name: F:Xceed.Http.CompressionLevel.Highest
member.summary: Maximum compression. Best compression ratio that the compression algorithm is capable of producing. Compared to the Normal compression level, this level significantly increases compression time for only slightly smaller compressed data. It is recommended to use this setting only when you really need to achieve the smallest possible files and when compression time is not important.

member.remarks: The versions should be in descending order beginning with the less restrictive up to the more restrictive.

member.name: P:Xceed.Http.HttpLicense.LicenseeType
member.summary: The type of the class or control that is licensed by this class (or, more exactly, a class derived from this one).
member.remarks: If more than one class is licensed by the XceedLicense class, the LicenseeType can simply be typeof( Licenser ).
